text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.
Due to economic instability and other factors plaguing the countries of the world, an agreement was made for each country to go into isolation, for the next 100 years.

Within the first year, all forms of communication were cut off, and the only way to communicate was through a network of satellites set up across nations in case of a severe emergency, that required the intervention of other countries to aid one another. However, the satellites were never utilized in the hundred of years of isolation. In fact, it appeared as if most countries were fine during isolation, able to recover economically and become stable as experts had predicted.
